page.title: 17In a manner of speaking
page.content: There is no particular way of speaking peculiar to Wolvey since it is much too small a place to have its own{ {ACCENT}or{DIALECT.} So many new people have moved into the village from other areas that there is a mixture of accents. A person who has lived and worked in Wolvey for many years may speak with an accent rather like Hinckley people of South Leicestershire or north of Coventry. A common error in{GRAMMAR}is to use the word "were" in place of "was",i.e. "It were a beautiful day yesterday". Similarly one might say "we was" instead of the correct "we were". There are other examples such as the{ {MIS-PRONUNCIATION}"fount" instead of "found" but this is not very widespread or obvious.
